title: 2 Easy Ways to Make a Chart with Two Y Axes in Excel

steps.title: Open a workbook in Microsoft Excel.
steps.content: Open a workbook in Microsoft Excel. You can use an existing project or create a new spreadsheet . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can use Excel to make tables , type formulas , and more.

steps.title: Highlight the data you want to graph.
steps.content: Highlight the data you want to graph. Click and drag over the cells containing the data you want to use in your line graph. If your data isn't already entered, do so now. Be sure to select column headers if you have them. [2] X Research source To select everything, click the top-left cell of the data. Press CTRL + A (Windows) or Command + A (Mac).

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. This is at the top toolbar. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the graph icon.
steps.content: Click the graph icon. This looks like two intersecting line graphs. You can find this in the Charts section.

steps.title: Hover over a graph style.
steps.content: Hover over a graph style. Hover the mouse cursor over a line graph template in the drop-down menu to see what it will look like with your data. The first section of graphs has traditional two-dimensional line graphs, while the second has one or more 3D line graphs. If you have a lot of data, the preview may take a moment to appear.

steps.title: Click a graph style to select it.
steps.content: Click a graph style to select it. Once you decide on a line graph template, clicking it will create your graph in the middle of the Excel window.

steps.title: Double-click the line you want to graph on a second axis.
steps.content: Double-click the line you want to graph on a second axis. Clicking the line once highlights each individual data point on the line. Double-clicking it displays the Format Data Series menu to the right. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the icon that resembles a bar chart.
steps.content: Click the icon that resembles a bar chart. This is the Series Options icon. It's at the top of the Format Data Point menu to the right.

steps.title: Click the bubble next to "Secondary Axis".
steps.content: Click the bubble next to "Secondary Axis". It's below the Series Options header in the Format Data Series menu. This immediately displays the line on a secondary axis with the numbers on the right side. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click the chart.
steps.content: Right-click the chart. If you haven't moved your chart, it should be in the middle of the Excel spreadsheet. This will open a drop-down menu next to the chart. On Mac, you can use a control-click .

steps.title: Click Change Chart Type….
steps.content: Click Change Chart Type… . A new window will open. If you aren't already on the Combo tab, find it in the left panel and click it. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the checkbox beside other lines you want to add to the Y-axis.
steps.content: Click the checkbox beside other lines you want to add to the Y-axis. To add other lines to the Y-axis, click the checkbox below Secondary Axis at the bottom half of the window. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select the type of chart for each data series.
steps.content: Select the type of chart for each data series. In addition to graphing a data series on a separate Y-axis, you can also graph it on a different chart type. Use the drop-down menu to select the chart type for each data series in the lower-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save and apply the changes you made to the chart. If you want to change the chart type for the entire chart, click the chart type in the menu to the left of the window and then double-click the chart style in the window.
